snippet: What happened to the G.O.P.’s vision of broader opportunity?
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Heather Cox Richardson suggests Republicans model their brand based on eras when GOP opposed the control of government by elite in favor of broader economic opportunity for all; says such values are at odds with current Republican emphasis on defending both wealth and wealthy; notes party has vacillated between both visions since 1800s, and warns practice of concentrating wealth among elite has historically had dire consequences.
lead_paragraph: What happened to the G.O.P.’s vision of broader opportunity?

headline.main: Bring Back the Party of Lincoln
